Israel strikes Gaza arms site after deadly night of bombing leaves over 100 dead
subhead: Israel said it struck an arms depot in northern Gaza hours after the deadliest night of bombing since the start of a US-brokered truce, warning it would keep operating against what it called 'imminent threats' despite mounting international calls to preserve the ceasefire.

title: French museums security under scrutiny in the Sénat after Louvre heist
subhead: A roundtable organized by the culture committee on October 29 highlighted outdated surveillance camera systems at the Louvre and the need for a comprehensive plan in response to a rise in burglaries.

title: 'By partnering with Shein, a symbol of globalized fast fashion, the BHV department store has muddled its own narrative'
subhead: The decision could have significant economic consequences for the Parisian department store at a time when public opinion has become a global strategic issue for companies, say communications specialists Céline Chanvin and Anne Zuccarelli, managing directors at the Vianova agency.

title: Jacques-Louis David, at home in the Louvre
subhead: The exhibition at the Paris museum brings together around a hundred works, paintings and drawings, including some on loan from Brussels, where the artist sought refuge after the Bourbon Restoration.

title: Too old to get a job, too young to retire: The French women over 50 stuck in limbo
subhead: In France, 21% of people aged 55-61 struggle to find work but are unable to retire. Women, who suffer more from societal inequalities throughout their career, are particularly at risk.
